Posts.Content: kpannabecker wrote: I feel like a hypochondriac but I've had to wait so long in between each test that I have too much time to think about it.  I'm going to be 50 in 2 months.  My mother had breast cancer at 50, my sister at 48 (both had lumpectomies/radiation and are fine today). Also my paternal grandmother had breast cancer and my parents have both had other cancers too.   I've always had fibrocystic, dense breasts.  A few months ago I began having "sensations" in my left breast and when I touched it it was a bit sensitive.  Not terribly painful but uncomfortable.  My family dr. sent me for an ultrasound.  They found something and my dr. made an appt. for me to see a breast specialist and have a biopsy but said it's probably nothing.  I had to wait 2 1/2 weeks to see the specialist.  All he got from my hospital was the report, no pictures from the US so he did a quick US, which I felt he did too quickly and said he saw what they probably saw but nothing "really scary". He said he didn't want to poke me (biopsy) until he saw more. He asked me to sign a release for my local hospital to send their US.  That took 2 weeks.  Next he wants me to have a bilateral digital mamogram.  Of course the appt. couldn't be for another 2 1/2 weeks.  In the meantime I've found another small lump that feels like a small piece of gravel in my lower left breast.  The sensitive lump, which has now become pretty painful (probably from me touching it so much) is right under my nipple and larger but not terribly hard.   What I'm worried about - besides having cancer - is they'll do the next mamogram and say I need a biopsy which I'll have to wait another 2 or 3 weeks to have.  That will be well over 2 months since I first went to my family doctor.  I'm hoping if they see something to be concerned about in the mamogram they'll book me right away for the biopsy.  Tonight my left arm feels achy and I have no idea if I'm beginning to imagine things or if they're really there.  My mamogram is Dec. 13th which feels like an eternity.  Do you think if they see something they think is cancer they'll make me wait 2 weeks to do more testing or do most drs. act quickly?  I'm getting frustrated buy trying not to be a whiner about it. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Have myself convinced I have cancer kpannabecker JanetM
